key_responsibilities: acting as a liaison with federal, district, and local agencies for the Member and constituents
strengthening community relations and assessing casework for problems requiring legislative action and/or Congressional oversight
briefing the Member in preparation for district meetings with constituents and acts as the representative for the Member by attending events and meetings

Building and maintaining relationships with constituents and key community leaders
Informing the District Director and Member on up-and-coming issues in the district
Performing constituent services and casework as assigned

Experience in maintaining relationships with constituents and community leaders
Political savvy and comfortable navigating complicated situations
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including public speaking skills
Ability to multi-task, manage time effectively, and adapt to changing priorities
Ability to work a flexible scheduling, including nights and weekends
Constituent service oriented; patient empathetic, and desire to help constituents

excellent organizational, research, writing, and communication skills
working knowledge of House processes and procedures
ability to concisely communicate and have strong time management skills and a willingness to work in a team environment

Knowledge of or ties to Pennsylvania a plus
